sub-events.comment: Completely blocks player input processing. Be careful when use. UX may suffer heavily.
param(0): input event name. One of "BLOCK", "UNBLOCK", "TOUCH_START", "TOUCHING", "TOUCH_END", "TOUCH_CANCEL", "KBD_TOUCHING" param(1): logical touch id. -1 on events that doesn't provide touch id.
We should consider any end of touch event as end of current INPUT_STATE. This allows to properly handle player's movement of cursor pointer and hiding of controls.
Set horizontal speed to 0 because it is not logically set to 0 when platform is disabled
